verses.verse: Then he called for his son Solomon, and charged him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.
And David said to Solomon: “My son, as for me, (2 Sam. 7:1, 2; 1 Kin. 8:17; 1 Chr. 17:1; 28:2) it was in my mind to build a house (Deut. 12:5, 11) to the name of the LORD my God;

but the word of the LORD came to me, saying, (2 Sam. 7:5-13; 1 Kin. 5:3; 1 Chr. 28:3) ‘You have shed much blood and have made great wars; you shall not build a house for My name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in My sight.

(1 Chr. 28:5) Behold, a son shall be born to you, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him (1 Kin. 4:20, 25; 5:4) rest from all his enemies all around. His name shall be Solomon, for I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.

(2 Sam. 7:13; 1 Kin. 5:5; 6:38; 1 Chr. 17:12, 13; 28:6; 2 Chr. 6:2) He shall build a house for My name, and (Heb. 1:5) he shall be My son, and I will be his Father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
Now, my son, may (1 Chr. 22:16) the LORD be with you; and may you prosper, and build the house of the LORD your God, as He has said to you.
Only may the LORD (1 Kin. 3:9-12; 2 Chr. 1:10) give you wisdom and understanding, and give you charge concerning Israel, that you may keep the law of the LORD your God.

((Josh. 1:7, 8); 1 Chr. 28:7) Then you will prosper, if you take care to fulfill the statutes and judgments with which the LORD charged Moses concerning Israel. ((Deut. 31:7, 8; Josh. 1:6, 7, 9; 1 Chr. 28:20)) Be strong and of good courage; do not fear nor be dismayed.

Indeed I have taken much trouble to prepare for the house of the LORD one hundred thousand talents of gold and one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron (1 Chr. 22:3) beyond measure, for it is so abundant. I have prepared timber and stone also, and you may add to them.
Moreover there are workmen with you in abundance: woodsmen and stonecutters, and all types of skillful men for every kind of work.
Of gold and silver and bronze and iron there is no limit. Arise and begin working, and (1 Chr. 22:11) the LORD be with you.”
David also commanded all the (1 Chr. 28:1-6) leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,

“Is not the LORD your God with you? (Deut. 12:10; Josh. 22:4; 2 Sam. 7:1; (1 Kin. 5:4; 8:56)) And has He not given you rest on every side? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the LORD and before His people.

Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God. Therefore arise and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, to (1 Kin. 8:1-11; 2 Chr. 5:2-14) bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy articles of God into the house that is to be built (1 Kin. 5:3) for the name of the LORD.”
(The Divisions of the Levites) So when David was old and full of days, he made his son (1 Kin. 1:33-40; 1 Chr. 28:4, 5) Solomon king over Israel.
And he gathered together all the leaders of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Now the Levites were numbered from the age of (Num. 4:1-3) thirty years and above; and the number of individual males was thirty-eight thousand.
Of these, twenty-four thousand were to (2 Chr. 2:2, 18; Ezra 3:8, 9) look after the work of the house of the LORD, six thousand were (Deut. 16:18-20) officers and judges,
four thousand were gatekeepers, and four thousand (1 Chr. 15:16) praised the LORD with musical instruments, (2 Chr. 29:25-27) “which I made,” said David, “for giving praise.”
Also (Ex. 6:16; Num. 26:57; 2 Chr. 8:14) David separated them into divisions among the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Of the (1 Chr. 26:21) Gershonites: Laadan and Shimei.
The sons of Laadan: the first Jehiel, then Zetham and Joel—three in all.
The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran—three in all. These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of Laadan.
And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These were the four sons of Shimei.
Jahath was the first and Zizah the second. But Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons; therefore they were assigned as one father’s house.
(Ex. 6:18) The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—four in all.

The sons of (Ex. 6:20) Amram: Aaron and Moses; and (Ex. 28:1; Heb. 5:4) Aaron was set apart, he and his sons forever, that he should sanctify the most holy things, (Ex. 30:7; 1 Sam. 2:28) to burn incense before the LORD, ((Deut. 21:5)) to minister to Him, and (Num. 6:23) to give the blessing in His name forever.
Now (1 Chr. 26:20-24) the sons of Moses the man of God were reckoned to the tribe of Levi.
(Ex. 18:3, 4) The sons of Moses were Gershon and Eliezer.
Of the sons of Gershon, (1 Chr. 26:24) Shebuel was the first.
Of the descendants of Eliezer, (1 Chr. 26:25) Rehabiah was the first. And Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
Of the sons of Izhar, (1 Chr. 24:22) Shelomith was the first.
